title: Cavolo Nero and Chilli Pesto
description: A traditional pesto is always going to be a undeniable classic, but the quantity of basil that needs to be bought always seem to cost an arm and a leg. And anyway, adding some extra green vegetables into the mix makes it feel a bit more nutritious. Cavolo nero is similar in taste to kale, however itâ€™s slightly less bitter and the leaves are more tender, though feel free to add any green leafy vegetable that you have to hand.
ingredients: 50g cavolo nero (or chard / kale), tough stems removed
method: Cook the pasta according to packet instructions in generously salted water.
Meanwhile, add all of the ingredients, plus a pinch of salt and a pinch of sugar,  to a food processor (blender or nutribullet). Blend until is has a paste like consistency.
Mix the pasta, pesto and a splash of the pasta water together, and stir to encorporate. Serve immediately. Alternatively, keep the pesto separate and store in the fridge for up to three days.
